text: Semiramis of the North is a designation given to some particularly capable female monarchs, after the legendary princess Semiramis of Assyria. Queens called by this name include: * Margaret I of Denmark (1353 - 1412)William Russell and Charles Coote. The History of Modern Europe. A. Small, 1822 pg.379 * Christina of Sweden (1626 - 1689)Susanna Åkerman. The Shapes of Knowledge from the Renaissance to the Enlightenment. * Catherine II of Russia (1729 - 1796)Martin E Malia. Russia under Western Eyes: From the Bronze Horseman to the Lenin Mausoleum. Harvard University Press, Jun 30, 2009 pg. 47 ==References== Category:Monarchy
title: Semiramis of the North
